text:
28th Street, north from 42nd Road to Bridge Plaza, showing the 'El' and the clock-tower Brewster Building.
P. L. Sperr  March 23, 1932

Hunter Street (right) at 28th Street, viewing north towards Bridge Plasa and showing the Queensboro Motion Picture House, which later became the Grace Church (view 2). The billboards are advertising "The Wreck," "Melting Millions," and "Collegians." One of these features is starring Lewis Stone and Lloyd Hughes. In view 2, in back of the church, is the Edison Building and to the left is the clock tower of the Brewster Building. The subway "K1" is on Bridge Plaza.
P. L. Sperr  View 1: June 6, 1927
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 2: March 23, 1932

Hunter Street (right) at 28th Street, viewing north towards Bridge Plasa and showing the Queensboro Motion Picture House, which later became the Grace Church (view 2). The billboards are advertising "The Wreck," "Melting Millions," and "Collegians." One of these features is starring Lewis Stone and Lloyd Hughes. In view 2, in back of the church, is the Edison Building and to the left is the clock tower of the Brewster Building. The subway "K1" is on Bridge Plaza.
P. L. Sperr  View 1: June 6, 1927
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 2: March 23, 1932
